name: Atrophied
effect: Whenever this creature deals damage to a target, it deals half as much damage as it would otherwise do.

name: Banished
effect: The creature is removed from existance temporarily, and thus cannot take actions or be targeted by any abilities. This status cannot be continuous or permanent in duration without some other condition that allows the creature to return to reality.

name: Bleeding {rank}
effect: The creature takes {ranks} in True Damage at the start of its turns until bleeding is stopped or duration expires. Creatures with no blood or blood-analog are immune to this effect.

name: Blessed
effect: May reroll 1 die per roll

name: Blinded
effect: Automatically fail attempts to see, increase difficulty to hit for attacks by 2

name: Bolstered {rank}
effect: May reroll {rank} dice per round

name: Burning {die size}
cost:
Cost of that damage die to apply
15 xp to remove
effect: The creature takes Fire Damage, at the start of its turn equal to a roll of the selected die unless it expends 2 AP to extinguish the fire or any creature logically extinguishes the fire

name: Charmed
effect: Creature regards the charmer as a friendly entity

name: Compel Truth
effect: Creature is unable to convey a known falsehood.

name: Confused
effect: Creature is unable to distinguish friend from foe. At the beginning of the creature's turn roll a d8 to indicate a direction with 1 being straight up. The creature attacks the nearest creature to that direction.

name: Crippled {rank}
effect: Creature has a Characteristic reduced by {ranks}, losing both its dice pool and any passive effects from that characteristic. When this status is removed any points lost from any pool are not restored.

name: Cursed
effect: Must reroll 1 successful die per roll

name: Deafened
effect: Automatically fail attempts to hear

name: Destroyed (items only)
effect: Weapon or Armor deals half damage or has half DR

name: Dominated
effect: Creature cannot disobey the commands of the Dominator, whenever the creature receives an order against its self preservation it may make DC3 Hard RES save to break free

name: Doomed
effect: The creature must be healed, cleansed, or use a breakthrough charge within 2 turns or at the beginning of its 3rd turn it will be instantly reduced to 0 HP. Unlike other status effects Doomed defaults to a duration of 3 rounds instead of 1.

name: DoT {Rank}
cost:
10xp per rank to apply
50 xp to remove all stacks
Immunity is only to one damage type
effect: Creature takes {rank} in damage at the start of its turn

name: Emotionally Manipulated
effect: The creature is manipulated to be currently feeling a specified emotion and acts accordingly.

name: Encumbered
effect: Reduce movement by half and reduce dice pools for all physical CHARs by 1

name: Enraged
effect: The afflicted creature MUST make a damaging attack on each of its turns. If no enemy targets are available while the effect persists, the creature must target a friendly creature or object in its vicinity to deal damage to.

name: Enraptured / Fixated
effect: The afflicted creature must pay attention to and not move more than 50 feet away from the target of the enrapture specified when the status is applied.

name: Excruciated {rank}
effect: The creature takes {ranks} slashing or psychic damage (or other damage type as appropriate) each time it takes an action.

name: Exhausted
effect: Creature reduces normal turn AP gain by 2 (does not reduce Haste effects), reduce their movement by 2 squares, and creature may only make a single non-move action on its turn.

name: Exposed {rank}
effect: Adds {ranks} automatic successes to attacks against this target

name: Feared / Repelled
effect: Creature cannot approach or attack source of fear/repel

name: Grappled
effect:
Only applies to creatures 1 size larger than you or smaller.
Grappled creatures may not move by any means. Grappled creatures may spend 3 AP to attempt a Med STR save or Med DEX save to break free.
Creatures grappling another may drag their grappled creature their movement distance minus the grappled creature's STR. The grappling creature may spend multiple AP to move at once with this penalty only applying once.

name: Hastened {rank}
effect: The creature gains {rank} bonus AP each time it gains AP, and does not affect the total AP storage limit. The creature also gains the rank of Hastened as AP immediately.

name: Hidden
effect: The creature will not be noticed by other creatures unless they succeed an opposed Stealth(DEX) vs Perception(CUN) check or the creature performs an action that reveals itself. Gain +1 die to attack creatures that don't know where you are. See Stealth rules.

name: Hobbled {rank}
effect: Movement actions are reduced by {rank} squares

name: HoT {Rank}
effect: Creature heals {rank} in HP at the start of its turn

name: Hyper-accelerated
effect: When the creature takes a move action or has movement applied to it, it may only move the maximum amount possible and in a straight line.

name: Incapacitated
effect: Movement reduced to 1, AP generation capped to 2, knocked prone

name: Infested (Minor Parasite)
effect: Creature has a parasite inside them, while this status persists, the parasite reapplies its own status each round.

name: Intangible
effect: The creatureï¿½s movement is not impeded by physical objects

name: Invisible
effect:
The creature is unable to be easily percieved by sight and may make stealth checks out in the open.
Creatures wishing to attack an invisible target must succeed an opposed Perception Vs Stealth check.

name: Invulnerable
effect: The creature's HP cannot be reduced by any damage or statuses.

name: Isolated
effect:
Creature may not benefit from any duration-based buff effects bestowed to them by allies or bestow buff effects to allies. 
Buff effects the creature bestows to itself are unaffected.

name: Jinxed {rank}
effect: Reroll {rank} dice that generated at least one success per round

name: Latched On
effect:
Only applies to creatures 2 or more sizes larger than you. You latch onto a large creature and are carried by it.
You automatically move with that creature, and the DC for that creature to hit you is increased by 1.

name: Marked
cost:
10 xp to apply
-50 xp when required
effect: By itself, this status does nothing, but it allows other abilities to require it to activate more cheaply.

name: Muted
effect: The creature cannot make any audible sounds.

name: Pacified
effect: The afflicted creature cannot take any action that deals damage.

name: Panicked
effect: Target creature makes audible sounds of distress and must make at least one move action in a random direction where they move their full movement allowance in haphazard manner, but will avoid any terrain hazards they are aware of.

name: Poisoned {rank}
effect: Target creature takes ranks in Toxic damage at the start of every one of their turns. Any RES saves this creature makes have their DC increased by 2.

name: Prone
effect: The creature is laying on the ground and must spend 1 AP to stand but provoke attacks of opportunity, or 2 AP to stand up without provoking any attack. While prone, a creature may still move, but treats their DEX as 1. Lasts until the target spends the AP

name: Rooted
effect: The creatureï¿½s movement speed is reduced to 0

name: Rotting
effect: Whenever this creature would be healed for any amount, it is not healed and instead takes that amount of healing as damage.

name: Sealed
effect: The creature may only spend AP to move

name: Sickened {rank}
effect: Increases the DC for all checks by {rank}

name: Silenced
effect: Cannot use Active Abilities with durations or that cost class resources to activate.

name: Sleep
effect: The creature is asleep and may not take any actions that require being conscious, and ends any concentration effects. If the creature takes any damage, receives any healing, or is roused via a 2 AP action they wake up and lose this status.

name: Slowed {rank}
effect: The creature gains {rank} less AP each time it gains AP, and does not affect the total AP storage limit. If a creature is slowed beyond its generation it becomes stunned. The creature also loses the rank of Slow from their AP immediately.

name: Speed Up {rank}
effect: Movement actions are increased by {rank} squares

name: Staggered
effect: The number of successes required to land a critical hit against this creature is reduced by 1

name: Strengthened {rank} {CHAR}
effect: Rolls the creature makes with the given CHAR are increased in pool size by {rank}

name: Stunned / Paralyzed
effect: The creature cannot use abilities or move. It still generates AP as normal.

name: Sundered {rank}
effect: Weapon or armor has Dmg or DR reduced by {ranks} until repaired, Destroyed at 5 Ranks

name: Taunted
effect: Creatures must attack the taunting creature with any attack or debuff rolls it makes. It cannot target creatures other than the taunting creature.

name: Terrified
effect: Creature cannot target enemies with abilities or attacks. It may aid allies as normal.

name: Twitching {rank}
effect: The creature increases the DC of ranged attacks by {rank}

name: Unconscious
effect: Creature is unable to perform any action that requires being conscious. Creature can be restored via a status cleanse, a 4 AP action to rouse, or 10 minutes passing.

name: Undetectable (Sense)
effect:
The creature cannot be detected using the specified sense, such as sound, touch, thermal, smell, etc.
For sight, use Invisible instead.

name: Unguarded / Unaware
effect: Damage to this target becomes a critical hit but removes this status from the damaged creature and any of its allies who notice the attack

name: Vulnerable
effect: Choose one damage type (other than true damage), damage of that type against this creature is doubled. Multiple instances of Vulnerable for the same damage type do not stack, unless one of them is inherent to the creature.

name: Vulnerable Greater
effect: All damage type is doubled against this target. Does not stack with Vulnerable unless inherent to the creature.

name: Weakened {rank} {CHAR}
effect: Rolls the creature makes with the given CHAR are reduced in pool size by {rank}

name: Wide Open
effect: Any Action this creature takes that consumes AP provokes attacks of opportunity from threatening creatures, these attacks do not cost AP

name: Withered
effect: The healing the creature receives is reduced by Half
